attributes.action: Save the NHS, Sign the NHS Covenant, Make It Legally Binding!
attributes.additional_details: The NHS was founded 70 years ago and since then everyone regardless of means, race or creed can avail of one of the best health provisions in the world. It is an amazing institution & currently, the doctors, nurses and staff are all that stands between us and the COVID-19 pandemic. However, 40 years of privatisation by successive governments have failed the NHS and the public who willingly & collectively pay for it. Sign the NHS Covenant & save for our grandchildren what our grandparents built.
attributes.background: The NHS Covenant asks all public representatives to commit to an NHS in full public ownership, fully funded, fair pay for its staff, an end to corporate exploitation, no public representative may profit from NHS policy. The NHS to be democratically managed by healthcare staff & service users.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Ensure continued Universal health cover by legally committing to a minimum spend: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300925

Create a National Health Insurance Tax for the NHS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313361

Raise the rate of income tax and corporation tax to fund the NHS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313995

Revoke the Health and Social Care Act 2012 and renationalise the NHS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300019

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
